image.altText: A woman with cropped hair, wearing glasses and a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Three decades after the landmark Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody, the Northern Territory parliament rejects a motion proposing the federal government establish an independent oversight body.

title.children: Motion calling for federal oversight of NT deaths in custody rejected

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".

title.children: Prospect of net zero an 'intolerable risk' for leaking Santos plant

image.altText: A man in a button-up shirt and tie walking out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris has been found guilty of physically assaulting four students, including choking a pupil and dragging students by the ear.

title.children: Former principal guilty on four counts of physically assaulting students

image.altText: A woman holds bills in front of her and looks stern

props.synopsis: Kerrie Matthews has been forced to sell personal items to afford life-saving diabetes equipment, and with skyrocketing bills she is putting her house on the market and leaving the Northern Territory.

title.children: $5 milk and $90 rent rises: NT cost of living pushing families into housing stress

image.altText: A young boy in a sporting team singlet plays by a river

props.synopsis: A witness at an inquest into the death of Alice Springs boy Mitchell Thomas has denied doctoring an electrical report in the wake of a fatal house fire.

title.children: Electrician denies 'witness contamination' in child house fire inquest

image.altText: A man smiles into the camera. A game demo can be seen on his computer in the background.

props.synopsis: Better known for its gas and iron ore, the Pilbara hopes to add gaming to its list of local exports as internet access and technology improve.

title.children: Regional developers cash in on the global gaming industry

image.altText: Minister for Indigenous Australians Malarndirri McCarthy stands at a lecturn during a press conference.

props.synopsis: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

title.children: 'Demands our country's full attention': Funding threat on Closing the Gap

image.altText: Two people on a beach with a large mass of fishing nets in front of them.

props.synopsis: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

title.children: The ocean's least natural predator has come for Australia

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has doubled down on its stance against detaining transgender women in female prisons, as a local LGBTQIA+ group says it is "horrified" by the comments.

title.children: Advocates condemn NT leader's comments on trans women in female prisons

image.altText: an Australian flag pictured on the uniform of Australian Army personnel.

props.synopsis: The Department of Defence says an Australian soldier has died after a single-vehicle rollover during training at the Australian Army's Townsville Field Training Area.

title.children: Army vehicle fleet suspended after training rollover kills soldier

image.altText: Girl with black nail polish, wearing a purple and black shirt, holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a number of families attended Eastwood Police Station on Wednesday evening after growing frustrated that a local high school had failed to act on a complaint.

title.children: Police investigating reports explicit deepfakes made of Sydney schoolgirls

image.altText: A composite image of Robbie Arnott, a man in his mid-30s, and Tasma Walton, a short-haired Indigenous woman in her early 50s.

props.synopsis: Robbie Arnott's Dusk about twins hunting a puma in Tasmania, and Tasma Walton's I Am Nannertgarrook about an Aboriginal woman kidnapped and sold into slavery, have tied to win the ARA Historical Novel Prize.

title.children: 'Impossible to elevate one above the other' as two authors split $100k prize

image.altText: Diane Keaton wearing a blue bowler hat and black, plaid turtleneck while smiling

props.synopsis: The actor's family says the 79-year-old died of pneumonia, expressing gratitude for the "extraordinary messages of love and support" received following news of her passing.

title.children: Keaton's cause of death revealed as fans urged to support shelters

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus smiles while holding a gold medal.

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus has given her life to a dream. As she sets off on her next adventures, she can be in no doubt that her years of sacrifice and devotion were worth it.

title.children: After a life of sacrifice, Ariarne Titmus can finally enjoy her greatness

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus gets ready to race

props.synopsis: The races that made Ariarne Titmus an Australian legend, from her maiden world championships appearance to her perfect Paris farewell.

title.children: From Budapest to Paris: The races that made Titmus a legend

image.altText: Rugby player running with the ball, trying to shed a defender off his waist

props.synopsis: The competition will not be played next year but will appear on the global calendar the following three years, including ahead of the 2027 Rugby World Cup, the organisers say.

title.children: Rugby Championship scrapped for 2026 due to Test calendar squeeze

image.altText: Former US military pilot Daniel Edmund Duggan seen as a pilot in Tasmania

props.synopsis: US authorities want Dan Duggan extradited from Australia for allegedly training Chinese pilots in South Africa in 2012. An appeal to avoid the extradition has started in the Federal Court today.

title.children: Former US Marine pilot appears in person at appeal against extradition

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit and red tie speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he authorised the CIA operation in part to stop the flow of "drugs coming in from Venezuela".

title.children: Trump confirms CIA conducting covert operations inside Venezuela

image.altText: A man wearing a short-sleeved navy blue button up collared shirt, standing on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: Samer Tarazi is one of thousands with strong ties to the Middle East region, watching from afar to see what the US-led peace plan means for the future.

title.children: 'Fear of the future' remains amid US-led peace plan in Gaza

image.altText: Batter raises his bat over his head, holding his helmet

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne has added to his case for selection in Australia's Test team for the Ashes, making an emphatic case for selection with his fourth century in five innings for Queensland.

title.children: Labuschagne continues scintillating form with 150 against Redbacks

image.altText: A man in a black shirt working behind a bar stares solemnly beyond the camera

props.synopsis: A new report shows there are just 16 affordable properties across the state for hospitality and childcare workers. It gets far worse if you live in a regional area.

title.children: Rentals for essential workers dry up amid housing crisis

image.altText: Josh Lees from Palestine Action Group

props.synopsis: The Palestine Action Group has won a NSW Supreme Court challenge against a law that limited protests near places of worship.

title.children: Court rules in favour of Palestine Action Group over NSW protest laws

image.altText: Soldiers in jumpsuits stand in formation on tarmac in front of a large reconnaisance plane.

props.synopsis: Australia's most sophisticated military surveillance plane was deployed 45 times next to Ukraine in the last three months as part of NATO efforts to monitor Russian activity.

title.children: Australian spy plane deployed 45 times during mission to help Ukraine

image.altText: Man stands next to Chinese flag at a podium

props.synopsis: Trump may have expressed "shock", but his administration is clearly not surprised at China's willingness to flex its dominance on rare earths.

title.children: Beijing's latest move shocked Trump but Australia sees an opportunity

image.altText: A derelict building

props.synopsis: Developers submit plans to build a $140 million, 34-storey residential tower on top of the derelict three-storey Broadway Hotel in Woolloongabba.

title.children: Plan to build apartments above derelict pub that can't be demolished

image.altText: Teddy Swims sitting on an orange chair in front of an orange wall wearing orange shades, black suit, tattoos, bald head

props.synopsis: Grammy-nominated music artist Teddy Swims says AI is a "beautiful tool" when it comes to composing music. Swims was in conversation at SXSW Sydney.

title.children: Teddy Swims occasionally uses AI to make music, but warns of its dangers

image.altText: GettyImages-2205357933

props.synopsis: It was one of the more chaotic AFL trade periods on record as picks and players moved all over the place — but who came out ahead the most?

title.children: Which team 'won' the AFL trade period — and does free agency need a fix?

image.altText: Silver Ferns captain Karin Burger and Australian Diamonds captain Liz Watson pose with a netball

props.synopsis: Imploring New Zealand Netball to reinstate coach Noeline Taurua, Silver Ferns skipper Karin Burger believes her team can put the turmoil aside when they face Australia in the Constellation Cup opener.

title.children: Coaching turmoil casts shadow over netball's Constellation Cup series

image.altText: A large concrete sign with letters saying National Gallery of Australia.

props.synopsis: The National Gallery will host an exhibition of art from the Aṉangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands three years after a video appearing to show a non-Aboriginal assistant helping to paint an artwork led to it being postponed.

title.children: National Gallery to host postponed APY artists exhibition after three years

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: A Perth man has described how having his all his electronic devices hacked has up-ended his life and left him feeling like "someone has walked into my bedroom with a knife".

title.children: Public wi-fi a major cause of hacking, consumer affairs authorities warn

image.altText: A man standing next to the Balibo Five sign.

props.synopsis: On the 50th anniversary of the Balibo Five murders, families are still grieving the loss of their loved ones and remain committed to holding those responsible accountable for their actions.

title.children: 'It still hurts': Families seek justice 50 years since the Balibo Five murders

image.altText: Woman shearing a lamb, with others watching on

props.synopsis: Nikki Lyons's clippers started humming at 6am. Twelve hours later, she was a world record holder.

title.children: Woman shears 502 merino lambs in nine hours to claim world record

image.altText: Screenshot of Elle Barker's video talking to her followers.

props.synopsis: A South Australian influencer has used her TikTok to warn others to be careful about sharing personal information in public, after a stranger memorised her phone number while she recited it to a cashier.

title.children: Influencer issues warning after stranger memorises phone number at check-out

image.altText: A small fluffy dog in a pet carrier container.

props.synopsis: Pets under 8 kilograms can now travel inside the passenger cabin on selected flights between Melbourne and the Gold and Sunshine Coasts.

title.children: Pets on planes trial takes first flight

image.altText: A drawing of an unhappy person with tangled thoughts floating from their mind.

props.synopsis: October marks Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) awareness month and the focus this year is on the many faces of the neurological condition.

title.children: Australian diagnoses are 'on the rise', but what does ADHD actually mean?
